snippet: Ben Macintyre’s “Double Cross” and Stephen Talty’s “Agent Garbo” both tell the histories of the double agents who were able to trick their German contacts about the Allied invasion.
abstract: Janet Maslin reviews books Double Cross: The True Story of the D-Day Spies by Ben Macintyre and Agent Garbo: The Brilliant, Eccentric Secret Agent Who Tricked Hitler and Saved D-Day by Stephan Talty.
lead_paragraph: Ben Macintyre’s “Double Cross” and Stephen Talty’s “Agent Garbo” both tell the histories of the double agents who were able to trick their German contacts about the Allied invasion.

headline.main: The Agents Who Fooled the Nazis About D-Day
headline.print_headline: The Agents Who Fooled The Nazis About D-Day
